de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator

Class ButtonBarDialogDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.AbstractDialogDecorator<ValidateableDialog>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.ButtonBarDialogDecorator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonBarDialogDecorator, Dialog

    public class ButtonBarDialogDecorator
extends AbstractDialogDecorator<ValidateableDialog>
implements ButtonBarDialogDecorator
    A decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ButtonBarDialogDecorator(ValidateableDialog dialog)
      Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean areButtonsStacked()
      Returns, whether the buttons of the dialog are aligned vertically, or not.
      Button getButton(int whichButton)
      Returns one of the buttons, which is shown by the dialog.
      int getButtonBarDividerColor()
      Returns the color of the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons.
      int getButtonTextColor()
      Returns the color of the button texts of the dialog.
      boolean isButtonBarDividerShown()
      Returns, whether the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons, is shown, or not.
      protected void onAttach(View view)
      The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is attached to the view hierarchy.
      protected void onDetach()
      The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is detached from the view hierarchy.
      void setButtonBarDividerColor(int color)
      Sets the color of the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons.
      void setButtonTextColor(int color)
      Sets the color of the button texts of the dialog.
      void setNegativeButton(java.lang.CharSequence text, DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
      Sets the text of the negative button of the dialog.
      void setNegativeButton(int resourceId, DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
      Sets the text of the negative button of the dialog.
      void setNeutralButton(java.lang.CharSequence text, DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
      Sets the text of the neutral button of the dialog.
      void setNeutralButton(int resourceId, DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
      Sets the text of the neutral button of the dialog.
      void setPositiveButton(java.lang.CharSequence text, DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
      Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog.
      void setPositiveButton(int resourceId, DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
      Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog.
      void showButtonBarDivider(boolean show)
      Sets, whether the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons, should be shown, or not.
      void stackButtons(boolean stackButtons)
      Sets, whether the buttons of the dialog should be aligned vertically, or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ButtonBarDialogDecorator

        public ButtonBarDialogDecorator(@NonNull
                                ValidateableDialog dialog)
        Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog, whose view hierarchy should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the type ValidateableDialog. The dialog may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • getButton

        public final Button getButton(int whichButton)
        Description copied from interface: ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Returns one of the buttons, which is shown by the dialog.
        Specified by:
        getButton in interface ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        whichButton - The identifier of the button, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The identifier must either be DialogInterface#BUTTON_POSITIVE, DialogInterface#BUTTON_NEGATIVE or DialogInterface#BUTTON_NEUTRAL
        Returns:
        The button, which corresponds to the given identifier, as an instance of the class Button or null, if the button is not shown or if the dialog has not been shown yet

      • setPositiveButton

        public final void setPositiveButton(@Nullable
                                    java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                    @Nullable
                                    DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog.
        Specified by:
        setPositiveButton in interface ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        text - The text, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no positive button should be shown
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the positive button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setPositiveButton

        Specified by:
